headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, X-GitHub-SSO, X-GitHub-Request-Id, Deprecation, Sunset

nodes.body:
This isn’t just a Python/asyncio edge case — it’s a trace integrity break under concurrency.

The trace lifecycle assumes:
	•	set_current_trace() and reset_current_trace(token) happen in the same logical context
	•	the token remains valid for the context that will later reset it

Under asyncio.gather() you get a state where:
	•	traces are marked as current across concurrent tasks
	•	tokens are created in one context state
	•	but reset attempts occur after other tasks have mutated the ContextVar state

That produces a failure mode where:
	•	the run may succeed
	•	but tracing becomes non-deterministic / crash-prone
	•	and the only safe workaround is disabling tracing (loss of observability)

Structurally: the system can execute concurrently, but the cleanup responsibility is not context-safe.

Any fix that guarantees trace start/finish happens within the same task-local context (or isolates per-task context) restores continuity without changing model behavior.

- Beaxis
https://github.com/openai/openai-agents-python/pull/2260 will be the solution for this; the change will be included in the upcoming release.
